Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring notice on former poll sites.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring notice on former poll sites.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the translation and publication of the New York city voters guide in additional languages.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Translation and publication of the New York city voters guide in additional languages.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to providing e-mail and text message notifications to New York city voters.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Providing e-mail and text message notifications to NYC voters.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to including information about candidates for federal, state, and county offices in the New York City voters guide.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Including information about candidates for federal, state, and county offices in the NYC voters guide.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to sending voting histories to voters
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the board of elections to send voting histories to voters.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign into law, A.9108 and S.6452-A, which would amend the election law to consolidate New York’s federal, state, and local primaries into one primary which would take place on the fourth Tuesday of June.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Consolidate NY’s federal, state, and local primaries into one primary which would take place on the fourth Tuesday of June. (A.9108 and S.6452-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Board of Elections to allow poll workers to work half-day shifts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Board of Elections to allow poll workers to work half-day shifts.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of A.4749/S.1703, an act to amend the election law in relation to requiring the New York City Board of Elections to provide Russian interpreters at certain polling locations.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYC Board of Elections to provide Russian interpreters at certain polling locations. (A.4749/S.1703)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.8582-A and S.3813-B, which would allow early voting in New York State.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Allow early voting in New York State (A.8582-A and S.3813-B)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.7634, which would amend both the New York State Election Law and the Correction Law, in relation to voting by convicted felons.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Voting by convicted felons. (A.7634)
